question: [File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: TransactionsResponse] [Version continuity] Does TransactionsResponse ensure transaction versions are continuous within processed_range, or can gaps cause state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: TransactionsResponse] [Empty response handling] Can TransactionsResponse have empty transactions but non-empty processed_range, indicating missing transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: TransactionsResponse] [Chain ID spoofing] Can a malicious indexer send responses with arbitrary chain_id values to confuse clients into accepting transactions from the wrong chain? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: StreamProgressSampleProto] [Timestamp manipulation] Can timestamp be set to far future or past values, causing incorrect progress tracking or time-based DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: StreamProgressSampleProto] [Version monotonicity] Does StreamProgressSampleProto validate that version increases monotonically across samples, or can decreasing versions cause confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: StreamProgressSampleProto] [Size overflow] Can size_bytes overflow when aggregated across many samples, causing incorrect bandwidth calculations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: StreamProgress] [Sample count limit] Is the samples vector bounded, or can attackers flood StreamProgress with millions of samples causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: StreamProgress] [Sample ordering] Does StreamProgress require samples to be chronologically ordered, or can out-of-order samples cause incorrect progress calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: ActiveStream] [Stream ID collision] Can multiple ActiveStreams have the same id, causing streams to interfere with each other or leak data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: ActiveStream] [Version range validation] Can start_version > end_version in ActiveStream, indicating an invalid stream that should be rejected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: ActiveStream] [Unbounded stream] Can end_version be None for infinite streams, and does this cause resource leaks or memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: ActiveStream] [Stream ID injection] Can malicious stream id strings contain special characters that cause command injection or path traversal when logged or stored? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: StreamInfo] [Active stream limit] Is active_streams bounded, or can an attacker create thousands of streams to exhaust server resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: StreamInfo] [Duplicate streams] Can active_streams contain duplicate stream IDs, causing confusion or allowing stream hijacking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: LiveDataServiceInfo] [Chain ID validation] Does LiveDataServiceInfo validate chain_id against expected values, or can malicious services advertise wrong chain IDs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: LiveDataServiceInfo] [Version rollback] Can known_latest_version decrease over time, indicating a chain rollback or reorganization that should trigger alerts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: LiveDataServiceInfo] [Min servable version gap] Can min_servable_version > known_latest_version, creating an impossible service state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: LiveDataServiceInfo] [Timestamp validation] Can timestamp be set to values that don't match wall clock time, causing time-travel attacks or stale data acceptance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: LiveDataServiceInfo] [Service unavailability bypass] Does None min_servable_version correctly indicate service unavailability, or can this be misinterpreted as 'serve everything'? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: HistoricalDataServiceInfo] [Chain ID mismatch] Can HistoricalDataServiceInfo advertise a different chain_id than LiveDataServiceInfo, causing historical data to be mixed with wrong chain? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: HistoricalDataServiceInfo] [Version lag exploitation] Can attackers exploit known_latest_version being behind live data to serve stale or manipulated historical data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: HistoricalDataServiceInfo] [Timestamp staleness] Does HistoricalDataServiceInfo validate timestamp freshness, or can extremely stale timestamps be used to hide service failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: FullnodeInfo] [Chain ID spoofing] Can malicious fullnodes advertise incorrect chain_id to trick indexers into connecting to wrong networks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: FullnodeInfo] [Version inflation] Can fullnodes advertise inflated known_latest_version to appear more advanced, winning service selection unfairly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.indexer.v1.rs] [Struct: FullnodeInfo] [Missing version validation] Does FullnodeInfo validate that known_latest_version is reasonable (not u64::MAX or 0), or can extreme values cause issues? (Low)
